data: Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Immediate Post Operative phase.  These orders continue on the inpatient unit
Discontinue GYN Gynecology Pre Operative (Day of Surgery) PowerPlan
Refer to reference text for appropriate Pathway for corresponding surgery
QID before food and bedtime for 24 hour, discontinue if blood glucose readings are less than 8.1 mmol/L for non-diabetic patient
Site: Surgical incision(s), Reinforce PRN, if saturated
Inpatient Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Post Operative (Floor) phase of this plan
Patient / family to be taught how to inject using enoxaparin (start post-op day 2) and to be given sharps container and appropriate teaching sheet
q1h for 2 hour then q4h for 24 hour then QID post-op day 1 then TID post-op day 2 then BID post-op day 3 then qdaily until discharge
on arrival to unit, then  q4h for 48 hour, then q8h for 48 hours, then q12h for 24 hour, then qdaily until discharge
For a new fever greater than 38.5 DegC
q2h for 24 hours, then q6h until catheter discontinued
Immediately after each spontaneous void, regardless of amount voided, using bladder scanner until voiding trials are complete
Stop post void residual if urine output is less than 100 mL stop trials
Indwelling, PRN, If unable to void after 4 hours OR post void residual greater than 200 mL on two occasions re-insert catheter and discontinue cather the following am
If post void residual is greater than 200 mL
Teach patient urinary catheter care and maintenance prior to discharge
Teach patient in and out catheterization if unable to complete voiding trials after 24 hours of tyring
Site: Abdomen, Remove dressing post-op day 1
Site: Abdomen, Remove dressing post-op day 2
Site: Abdomen, Change dressing post-op day 2
Empty and Record Output q6h, discontinue hemovac if output is less than 30 mL / 12 hours
Empty and Record Output q6h, discontinue bulb suction drain if output is less than 30 mL / 12 hours
T+4;0800, See Primary Care Physician (post-op day 4 to 6) for staple removal. Give patient staple remover plus or minus steri strips
T+4;0800, See Most Responsible Physician (post-op day 4 to 6) for staple removal. Give patient staple remover plus or minus steri strips
T+7;0800, See Primary Care Physician (post-op day 7 to 10) for staple removal. Give patient staple remover plus or minus steri strips
T+7;0800, See Most Responsible Physician (post-op day 7 to 10) for staple removal. Give patient staple remover plus or minus steri strips
T+10;0800, See Primary Care Physician (post-op day 10 to 14) for staple removal. Give patient staple remover and steri strips
T+10;0800, See Most Responsible (post-op day 10 to 14) for staple removal. Give patient staple remover and steri strips
Encourage gum chewing for 15 minutes PO TID (when awake until day of discharge)
Post-op day 0, then on post-op day 1 advance to Post-Op Surgical Transition Diet with Boost BID, then advance to General Diet as tolerated
Boost 1.5 Plus Calories, Breakfast | Dinner, BID when diet advanced to Diet as Tolerated post-op day 1
T;N, Advance diet to post-op surgical transition diet (diet post-op surgical diet) when hungry
T;N, Advance diet to regular diet, when hungry
When drinking greater than or equal to 600 mL over 12 hours
When drinking well and IV medications are discontinued and condition is stable
If patient is greater than 60 years of age, consider lower infusion rate

If Pasero sedation score greater than 2 and / or respiratory rate is 8/min or less:
Antibiotic prophylaxis is provided and completed pre-op. There is no indication to continue antibiotic prophylaxis into post-op period.
4 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 3 doses/times, drug form: inj
150 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
40 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
